titleStmt.title: John Cochran et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2382

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p: To His Excellency B. Magoffin Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky,

The Undersigned Citizens of Spencer County in District No One would respectfully state that the office of Justice of the peace has become Vacant by the permanent removal of Nathan Beauchamp Esq to the state of Missouri, We therefore petition your Excellency to appoint * John Henry to fill said Vacancy until the next August Election, Decr. 17d. 1860.

* John Henry
John Cochran
George Stone
R Cochran
Almanzor Allen
Thomas H Hughes
James A Martin
John C. Van Dyke
F M
J M Heady
J L Boswell
W S Davis
Charles W Perry
James Van Dyke
George Reynolds
J. James D. Oversbie
David
Thomas Gilbert
James Van Dyke, Sen.
Stephen. D. Martin

J. P. Dist No 1
John Henry
vice
N. Beauchamp
Com Iss' Decr. 22 1860
